Dimension reduction¶

Here we show a small use case of how to do a dimension reduction on a small sample data set (data/iris.tsv). We assume you already set up the cluster for Spark (other check here) with an IP address.

Analysis¶

For analysis we decide use a linear discriminant analysis to map data into a lower dimensional space. PyBDA offers the following methods to do dimension reduction:

  • pca for principal component analysis,
  • factor_analysis for factor analysis,
  • kpca for kernel principal component analysis using Fourier features to approximate the kernel,
  • lda for linear discriminant analysis,
  • ica for independent component analysis.

The config file we need to specify is in this case rather concise:

Contents of data/pybda-usecase-dimred.config file¶
spark: spark-submit
infile: data/iris.tsv
outfolder: data
features: data/iris_feature_columns.tsv
dimension_reduction: lda
n_components: 2
response: Species
sparkparams:
  - "--driver-memory=1G"
  - "--executor-memory=1G"

In the config above we will do the following:

  • Use a linear discriminant analysis to map the data set into a two-dimensional space using Species as a response.
  • give the Spark driver 1G of memory and the executor 1G of memory.

Having the parameters set, we call PyBDA

pybda dimension-reduction pybda-usecase-dimred.config IP
